Question
========

In a study of the length of time it takes to make a decision about purchasing a home based on photo opportunities, researchers assigned 30 people randomly assigned to one of two conditions: (1) 20 photos of the house were shown and (2) 5 photos of the house were shown. The mean of group (1) was 60 minutes and standard deviation 10; the mean of group (2) was 120 minutes and standard deviation 12. The researchers assume that the standard deviations in the population are are equal and thus arrive at a *standard error* of 4.033 and 28 degrees of freedom. A 95% confidence interval for the difference 1 - 2 is

Answerlist
----------

* (-60.26, -57.74).
* (-64.26, -53.74).
* (-68.26, -51.74).

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* (-60.26, -57.74).: Incorrect
* (-64.26, -53.74).: Incorrect
* (-68.26, -51.74).: Correct
